intro: Eleocharis levinae, commonly known as the slender spike-rush, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and small, clustered inflorescences. Native to wetland environments, it thrives in shallow water or moist soil conditions. The plant produces tiny, wind-pollinated flowers, which are typically inconspicuous. It plays an important role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various aquatic organisms.
